xxl.core.pipes.memoryManager
Class GlobalMemoryManager

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.pipes.memoryManager.GlobalMemoryManager

public class GlobalMemoryManager
extends Object

Main class for distributing main memory among the memory-using objects. All memory-using objects have to be memory manageable, and they call the register-method of this GlobalMemoryManager.

Since:
1.1

Field Summary
protected  Strategy strategy
          The strategy how to distribute memory among the memory-using objects.
 
Constructor Summary
GlobalMemoryManager(int globalMemSize)
          Constructs a GlobalMemoryManager with a uniform memory distribution strategy and a specified amount of global main memory.

          Constructs a GlobalMemoryManager with a specified strategy for memory distribution.

Constructs a GlobalMemoryManager with a uniform memory distribution strategy and a specified amount of global main memory.

getCurrentMemUsage

public int getCurrentMemUsage()
Returns the total amount of memory which is assigned to the registered memory-using objects.

Returns:
Returns the total amount of assigned memory (in bytes).

setStrategy

public void setStrategy(Strategy newStrategy)
Sets a new strategy for memory distribution. This method also deregisters all memory-using objects at the old strategy and registers them at the new strategy.

Parameters:
newStrategy - The new strategy for memory distribution.

getStrategy

public Strategy getStrategy()
Returns the strategy object which is actually used for memory distribution.

Returns:
Returns the strategy for memory distribution.

register

public void register(MemoryMonitorable memUser)
Registers a memory-using object.

Parameters:
memUser - the memory-using object to register.

deregister

Deregisters a memory-using object.

Parameters:
memUser - the memory-using object to deregister.

getMemUsers

Returns an iterator of the registered memory-using objects.

Returns an iterator of the memory-using objects.

getNoOfManagedMemUsers

public int getNoOfManagedMemUsers()
Returns the number of actually registered memory-using objects.

Returns:
Returns the number of actually registered memory-using objects.

requestForMemory

public void requestForMemory(MemoryManageable memUser,
                             int newMemSize)
Receives a request for an amount of memory from a memory-using object. This method returns immediately, but without a return value. The memory-using object recognises whether its request is approved, by observing, if its assignMemSize-method is called in an appropriate way or not.

Parameters:
memUser - the requesting memory-using object.
newMemSize - the desired amount of memory (in bytes).
